Header: Ninety-one-year-old shows kids how Bungee jumping is done
Content: Ninety-one-year-old Mary Manssen decided to show the young kids how it is done and bungee jump off a bridge in Queenstown. The crowd roared as the daredevil leaped into the New Zealand landscape. Manssen started her bungee jumping career in 2008, at the ripe age of 84. She has also taken a helicopter ride in the snow and plans on parasailing after her latest effort was affected by a fellow traveler’s sickness. It is also a exciting fact that she has seven children, 18 grandchildren, 35 great grandchildren and one great great grandchild. She is one busy lady. Grandma Manssen is the oldest female to jump at the site — only to be beaten by a 94-year-old gentleman [image_sliders] [image_slider link=”full_url_link” source=”http://newsfirst.lk/english/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/nana2.jpg”]  [/image_slider] [image_slider link=”full_url_link” source=”http://newsfirst.lk/english/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/mary1.jpg”] [/image_slider] [image_slider link=”full_url_link” source=”http://newsfirst.lk/english/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/mary2.jpg”]  [/image_slider] [/image_sliders]
